alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Houston (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 2:34AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Impactful Winter Storm Expected from Tonight into Tuesday Night... .A winter storm is expected to bring impactful and hazardous winter weather to the region starting tonight. Conditions are expected to be the worst from late tonight into Tuesday evening. Hourly snow rates will range from 1 to 2 inches an hour in parts of northeast Iowa, and southwest and central Wisconsin from late tonight into Tuesday afternoon. A total of 8 to 12 inches of snow is expected in these areas. Up to 40 mph wind gusts are expected at times from Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday night. This will result in blowing and drifting snow, especially in more open areas. The path of this storm could still shift which would result in a change in snowfall amounts. This is why there is a Winter Storm Watch along and north of Interstate 90. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Iowa, Howard County. In Minnesota, Fillmore and Houston Counties. In Wisconsin, La Crosse County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
